intro: Tithymalus nicaeensis subsp. pannonicus, commonly known as the Pannonian tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing small white to pale yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly broader leaves and more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
